text: Jhajhoo () is a large rural village located in Kolayat Tehsil of Bikaner of Rajasthan state, India. It is located from Jaipur, from Jodhpur, and from Mount Abu. In accordance with the Panchyati Raaj Act the village is administrated by a sarpanch (head of the village), who is elected every five years. In 2011 the population in the village was 7574, comprising 1229 households. ==References== Category:Villages in Bikaner district
title: Jhajhoo
